mdRecord.dcterms:title: Fredericksburg, 1850: Dear Sir: The undersigned patentees, take this method of bringing to your notice, their "Patent Cordage Machine," for making cordage of any length and size / Orders promptly attended to, and any information on the subject cheerfully given, if addressed to F. & J.W. Slaughter, Fredericksburg, Virginia. ; F. Slaughter, D. Perry, J.W. Slaughter
Dear Sir: The undersigned patentees, take this method of bringing to your notice, their "Patent Cordage Machine"
Undersigned patentees, take this method of bringing to your notice, their "Patent Cordage Machine"
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Slaughter, Franklin.
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: F. Slaughter, D. Perry, J.W. Slaughter
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 25 x 40 cm. folded to 25 x 20 cm.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Printed circular letter, with text on p. [1] of a folded sheet.
Date of letter, 20th Sept., and prices for three varieties of machines added in manuscript. Addressed on p. [4] to Warren Manufactg. Co., Warren, R.I.; postmarked Fredericksburg Va. Sep. 20.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Cordage
Cordage industry--Virginia--Fredericksburg
Cordage industry--United States
